Author: jl777c#5810
Content: right now the notarization check is a stub

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but once a channel is created, it is a matter of making a payment

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: system is backwards compatible with wallets, explorers, etc. nothing special to setup

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: though we would want a GUI that can indicate when the mempool payment arrives

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so right now, you should be able to break the payment with a reorg

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but it is a matter to then add notarization and notarization check, then that makes it dPoW protected mempool payment

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: What is a stub?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: (too silly to know if that is a silly question)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think that refers to a function in the code that doesn't do anything

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it just says "notarized:true"

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: üëç

Content: Ok, thanks.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Could `channels` be compared to a prepaid debit card?  Bought with `channelsopen`?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: instant verification

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: great for Starbucks, etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: smaller coins can get immediate and secure credit for purchases

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: I guess more like a Starbucks card, only useable at Starbucks.  Need a different card for each business?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: true, it is 100% p2p

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe some intermediary will setup some sort of hub service

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: I wonder there may be some hub with points

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which is possible, just not mandated like it is for LN

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Like a rabbit card here in Thailand - you have card can pay in metro, mcdonalds, burgerkings and etc

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: A prepaid wallet app.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, as long as the hub takes care of the backend, why not

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they can know their payment is securely received

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so this seems the proper way to do LN

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: make it 100% p2p at the low level, backward compatible and not require both nodes to be online

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then you can add a hub on top without requiring an entirely new set of daemons, wallets, explorers, payment processors, etc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: seems a nice clean and efficient design
